long_description:
= DESCRIPTION:

Installs Ruby Enterprise Edition (REE) from Phusion.

= REQUIREMENTS:

Opscode's build-essential cookbook to get a compiler and associated files installed.

= ATTRIBUTES: 

* ruby_enterprise[:install_path] - Location to install REE. Default /opt/ruby-enterprise
* ruby_enterprise[:version] - Version-datestamp to use. Default 1.8.7-2012.02. May lag behind latest REE release.
* ruby_enterprise[:dev_docs] - Defaults to false, set to true to install developer documentation. Uses the --no-dev-docs option.
* ruby_enterprise[:install_useful_gems] - Default true. Installs various useful gems such as Rake, Bundler, Rails, etc.

Deprecated Attributes
* ruby_enterprise[:url] - The URL is determined by combining the version with the google code .tar.gz file.

= USAGE:

Include the ruby_enterprise recipe to install REE.

    include_recipe "ruby_enterprise"

Or add it to your role, or directly to a node's recipes.

Note that this recipe disables the REE installer's default behavior of
automatically installing the most recent versions of some additional gems
(passenger, rails, mysql, etc.).

Install RubyGems under REE with the ree_gem definition.

    ree_gem "rails" do
      source "http://gems.rubyforge.org"
      version "2.3.4"
    end

The definition supports parameters for source and version, though they are optional.
